workflow.name: Monitor and report OKR variance from Monday.com and Jira via Slack and Email
workflow.description:
## Description
Synchronize OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) between Monday.com and Jira to automatically calculate progress variance, update dashboards, and share variance reports via Slack and Outlook. This workflow ensures teams have accurate, real-time visibility into performance metrics and project alignment ‚Äî without manual reconciliation. üéØüìàüí¨

## What This Template Does
- Step 1: Triggers daily at a scheduled time to fetch the latest OKRs from Monday.com. ‚è∞
- Step 2: Extracts Key Results and their linked Jira epic keys from the OKR board. üîó
- Step 3: Fetches corresponding Jira epic details such as status, assignee, and last updated date. üß©
- Step 4: Merges Monday.com KR data with Jira epic progress through SQL-style joins. üìã
- Step 5: Calculates real-time progress and variance against target goals. üìä
- Step 6: Updates Monday.com KR items with actual progress, variance percentage, and status (‚ÄúOn Track‚Äù, ‚ÄúAt Risk‚Äù, or ‚ÄúAhead‚Äù). üîÑ
- Step 7: Aggregates all KR data into a consolidated report for communication. üì¶
- Step 8: Sends formatted variance reports to Slack and Outlook, with summaries of owner, progress, and variance metrics. üì¢

## Key Benefits
‚úÖ Automates end-to-end OKR and Jira synchronization
 ‚úÖ Eliminates manual progress tracking errors
 ‚úÖ Provides daily visibility on team and project health
 ‚úÖ Enables proactive risk detection via variance thresholds
 ‚úÖ Keeps all stakeholders updated via Slack and Outlook
 ‚úÖ Centralizes OKR performance metrics for reporting

## Features
- Daily scheduled trigger for automatic OKR sync
- Monday.com ‚Üí Jira data integration via API
- Real-time variance computation logic
- Automatic updates of OKR fields in Monday.com
- SQL-style data merging and aggregation
- Slack notification with variance summaries
- Outlook email digest with formatted HTML tables

## Requirements
- Monday.com API credentials with board access
- Jira API credentials with permission to view epics
- Slack Bot token with chat:write permissions
- Microsoft Outlook OAuth2 credentials for sending emails
- Environment variables for board, channel, and recipient configuration

## Target Audience
- Product and engineering teams managing OKRs across platforms üéØ
- Project managers tracking cross-tool performance metrics üìã
- Leadership teams needing automated OKR reporting üíº
- Operations and strategy teams monitoring execution health üß≠

## Step-by-Step Setup Instructions
- Connect your Monday.com, Jira, Slack, and Outlook credentials in n8n. üîë
- Replace MONDAY_BOARD_ID, GROUP_ID, and column identifiers with your own. üß©
- Set environment variables for SLACK_CHANNEL_ID and REPORT_RECIPIENT_EMAIL. üí¨
- Adjust the cron expression to define your sync frequency (e.g., daily at 9 AM). ‚è∞
- Test the workflow with a single OKR item to confirm successful synchronization. üß†
- Enable the workflow to automate daily OKR variance tracking and reporting. ‚úÖ

workflow.name: Monitor and Report OKR Variance from Monday.com and Jira via Slack and Email

parameters.content:
## üéØ OKR Sync & Variance Tracking System

This workflow automates the synchronization of OKRs (Objectives and Key Results) between Monday.com and Jira, calculating progress variance and sending automated reports.

**What it does:**
- Fetches Key Results from Monday.com boards
- Links each KR to corresponding Jira Epics
- Calculates actual progress based on epic statuses
- Computes variance against target progress
- Updates Monday.com with real-time metrics
- Sends reports via Slack and Email

**Use Cases:**
- Product teams tracking quarterly OKRs
- Engineering managers monitoring sprint alignment
- Leadership dashboards for strategic planning

**Prerequisites:**
- Monday.com board with OKR structure
- Jira project with linked epics
- Slack workspace access
- Microsoft Outlook account

## ‚è∞ Schedule Configuration

**Setup Steps:**
1. Click on this node
2. Set your desired interval (daily/weekly)
3. Choose optimal run time (e.g., 9 AM daily)
4. Consider timezone settings

**Best Practice:** Run during off-peak hours to avoid API rate limits

## üìã Monday.com Board Setup

**Required Columns:**
- Objective Name (text)
- Jira Epic Keys (text, comma-separated)
- Target Progress (number, %)
- Current Progress (number, %)
- Threshold (number, %)
- Owner's Email (email)
- Status (status)
- Date (date)

**Configuration:**
1. Replace boardId with your board ID
2. Replace groupId with your group ID
3. Connect your Monday.com credentials

## üîÑ Field Mapping

This node extracts and standardizes Monday.com column data into a consistent schema.

**What it does:**
- Maps column indices to readable field names
- Prepares data for downstream processing
- Ensures type consistency

**Note:** If Monday.com column order changes, update the column_values[index] references

nodes.name: Map Monday Fields ‚Üí Standard KR Schema

parameters.content:
## üîÄ Epic Splitting Logic

Each KR can track multiple Jira epics (comma-separated). This node creates one item per epic-KR pair.

**Example:**
- Input: KR-123 ‚Üí EPIC-1, EPIC-2
- Output: 2 items (KR-123‚ÜíEPIC-1, KR-123‚ÜíEPIC-2)

**Why?** Allows parallel fetching of epic data and accurate progress calculation

## üîó Jira Integration

**Setup:**
1. Connect your Jira credentials
2. Ensure the Jira account has read access to all linked epics
3. Test with a single epic key first

**Rate Limits:** Jira Cloud allows 150 requests/min. This workflow respects those limits via sequential processing

## üßπ Response Normalization

Jira API returns nested complex objects. This node flattens and extracts only the fields needed for progress calculation:

- Issue key
- Summary (name)
- Status (for progress weighting)
- Assignee
- Dates

## üîó SQL Merge Strategy

This node performs a LEFT JOIN to combine:
- Input 1: KR metadata (from Monday)
- Input 2: Epic details (from Jira)

**Result:** Each KR-Epic pair with complete context for variance calculation

parameters.query:
SELECT 
  a.kr_id,
  a.kr_name,
  a.epic_key,
  a.target_progress,
  a.current_progress,
  a.threshold,
  a.owner_email,
  b.name AS epic_name,
  b.status AS epic_status,
  b.assignee AS epic_assignee,
  b.updated AS epic_updated
FROM input1 a
LEFT JOIN input2 b
ON a.epic_key = b.key

parameters.content:
## üìä Progress Calculation Logic

**Status Weights:**
- To Do = 0%
- In Progress = 50%
- Done = 100%

**Formula:**
- Actual Progress = Average of all epic weights
- Variance = Actual - Target
- Status = At Risk if variance > threshold

**Output:** One aggregated item per KR with computed metrics

## ‚úçÔ∏è Monday.com Update

**Configuration Needed:**
1. Replace column IDs with your actual Monday board column IDs:
   - MONDAY_COL_ACTUAL_PROGRESS ‚Üí Actual Progress column
   - MONDAY_COL_VARIANCE ‚Üí Variance column
   - MONDAY_COL_STATUS ‚Üí Status column

2. Find column IDs via Monday.com API or inspect board settings

## üì¶ Aggregation for Reporting

Combines all KR variance data into a single payload for reporting nodes.

**Output:** Array of all KRs with their computed metrics, ready for Slack/Email formatting

## üí¨ Slack Notification

**Setup:**
1. Replace channelId with your Slack channel ID
2. Or use environment variable: SLACK_CHANNEL_ID
3. Customize message formatting as needed

**Tip:** Use Slack's Block Kit Builder for richer formatting

## üìß Email Notification

**Setup:**
1. Replace hardcoded email with: REPORT_RECIPIENT_EMAIL env variable
2. Or use dynamic owner emails from data
3. Customize HTML template as needed

**Note:** Ensure Outlook credentials have send permissions

parameters.subject: =OKR Variance Report ‚Äî {{$now}}
parameters.bodyContent:
=

‚öôÔ∏è OKR Variance Report ‚Äî {{$now}}

{{ $json.data.map((item, i) => `

${i+1}. ${item.kr_name}

Owner: ${item.owner_email}

Target: ${item.target_progress}%

Actual: ${item.actual_progress}%

Variance: ${item.variance}%

Epics Linked: ${item.epic_count}

Status: ${item.status}

Last Updated: ${item.last_updated}
`).join('') }}

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.
